channel.title: beverages on Logotyp.us
channel.description: Recent content in beverages on Logotyp.us

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Agrokor Logo
Agrokor was a conglomerate, largely centered in agribusiness, with headquarters in Zagreb, Croatia. Founded in 1976 as a flower grower, it became a joint stock company in 1989, with 100 percent ownership held by founder Ivica Todorić. It greatly expanded its operations in the following 25 years by acquiring a number of large companies in Croatia and Southeast Europe. The Agrokor group had an annual sales revenue of €6.465 billion in 2015, which made it the second largest retail and eleventh largest overall company in all of Southeast Europe.
You can download theAgrokorlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Agrokor
item.description: Agrokor was a conglomerate, largely centered in agribusiness, with headquarters in Zagreb, Croatia. Founded in 1976 as a flower grower, it became a joint stock company in 1989, with 100 percent ownership held by founder Ivica Todorić. It greatly expanded its operations in the following 25 years by acquiring a number of large companies in Croatia and Southeast Europe. The Agrokor group had an annual sales revenue of €6.465 billion in 2015, which made it the second largest retail and eleventh largest overall company in all of Southeast Europe.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Cevital Logo Cevital is the largest private conglomerate in Algeria, with interests in the agri-food sector, retail, industry and services, created by Issad Rebrab. The company’s headquarters are in Béjaïa, Algeria. Cevital is a founding member of the Desertec project. The company’s earnings in 2009 were US$3,589 million. Source
You can download theCevitallogo on full-version of the page. ]] >

item.description: Cevital is the largest private conglomerate in Algeria, with interests in the agri-food sector, retail, industry and services, created by Issad Rebrab. The company’s headquarters are in Béjaïa, Algeria. Cevital is a founding member of the Desertec project. The company’s earnings in 2009 were US$3,589 million. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Chapman's Logo
Chapman’s is the largest independent ice cream and ice water products manufacturer in Canada. Chapman’s produces products under the company brand name, as well as store brand products. They are also known for their range of ice creams for people with special dietary needs. Chapman’s Products are distributed across Canada. The company was the first dairy products company in Ontario to have its own wastewater treatment plant. They have been recognized by their industry and by the Province of Ontario for their ecological leadership.
You can download theChapmanslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Chapmans
item.description: Chapman’s is the largest independent ice cream and ice water products manufacturer in Canada. Chapman’s produces products under the company brand name, as well as store brand products. They are also known for their range of ice creams for people with special dietary needs. Chapman’s Products are distributed across Canada. The company was the first dairy products company in Ontario to have its own wastewater treatment plant. They have been recognized by their industry and by the Province of Ontario for their ecological leadership.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Fyffes Logo
Fyffes plc is a Japanese-owned fruit and fresh produce company headquartered in Dublin, Ireland. The Fyffes brand is most closely associated with the banana industry, although it is applied to a wide range of fruits and fresh produce, including the Fyffes Gold Pineapples, mushrooms and Fyffes melons. Fyffes is primarily involved in the production, procurement, shipping, ripening, distribution and marketing of bananas, pineapples, mushrooms and melons. Fyffes currently markets fruit in Europe and the United States, primarily under the Fyffes and Turbana brands.
You can download theFyffeslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Fyffes
item.description: Fyffes plc is a Japanese-owned fruit and fresh produce company headquartered in Dublin, Ireland. The Fyffes brand is most closely associated with the banana industry, although it is applied to a wide range of fruits and fresh produce, including the Fyffes Gold Pineapples, mushrooms and Fyffes melons. Fyffes is primarily involved in the production, procurement, shipping, ripening, distribution and marketing of bananas, pineapples, mushrooms and melons. Fyffes currently markets fruit in Europe and the United States, primarily under the Fyffes and Turbana brands.

Gaggia Logo Gaggia is an Italian company that makes coffee machines, especially espresso and cappuccino machines, in addition to small kitchen appliances. The company is owned by Saeco International Group. Source
You can download theGaggialogo on full-version of the page. ]] >

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Gevalia Logo
Gevalia is the largest coffee roastery in Scandinavia. In North America, the company sells coffee directly to consumers via home delivery and through big box stores such as Wal-Mart. Gevalia discontinued sales of tea in 2015. Customers order from a customer service center and a website that was relaunched in August 2009. In North America, Gevalia is a wholly owned subsidiary of Kraft Heinz based in Chicago, Illinois. Gevalia produces more than 40 different varieties of coffee and tea.
You can download theGevalialogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Gevalia
item.description: Gevalia is the largest coffee roastery in Scandinavia. In North America, the company sells coffee directly to consumers via home delivery and through big box stores such as Wal-Mart. Gevalia discontinued sales of tea in 2015. Customers order from a customer service center and a website that was relaunched in August 2009. In North America, Gevalia is a wholly owned subsidiary of Kraft Heinz based in Chicago, Illinois. Gevalia produces more than 40 different varieties of coffee and tea.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Goodman Fielder Logo Goodman Fielder is a joint Hong Kong/Singapore-owned manufacturer, marketer and distributor of bread, small goods, dairy products, margarine, oil, dressings and various food ingredients. Its main operations are in New Zealand, Australia, Fiji, Papua New Guinea, and New Caledonia, with over 40 manufacturing sites. The company employs over 5,000 people, and has more than 120 brands. Source
You can download theGoodman Fielderlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Lavazza Logo Luigi Lavazza S.p.A. is an Italian manufacturer of coffee products. Founded in Turin in 1895 by Luigi Lavazza, it was initially run from a small grocery store at Via San Tommaso 10. The business of Lavazza S.p.A. is currently administered by the third and fourth generations of the Lavazza family. Source
You can download theLavazzalogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Lavazza
item.description: Luigi Lavazza S.p.A. is an Italian manufacturer of coffee products. Founded in Turin in 1895 by Luigi Lavazza, it was initially run from a small grocery store at Via San Tommaso 10. The business of Lavazza S.p.A. is currently administered by the third and fourth generations of the Lavazza family. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Mead Johnson Logo
Mead Johnson & Company, LLC is an American division and subsidiary of British company Reckitt Benckiser. It is a leading manufacturer of infant formula both domestically and globally with its flagship product Enfamil. The company dates back to a firm created by Edward Mead Johnson, one of the co-founders of Johnson & Johnson, who created his own business in 1895, which was renamed Mead Johnson & Company in 1905. The company was majority owned by Bristol-Myers Squibb after an acquisition in 1967, but was spun-off in 2009 as an independent firm.
You can download theMead Johnsonlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Mead Johnson
item.description: Mead Johnson & Company, LLC is an American division and subsidiary of British company Reckitt Benckiser. It is a leading manufacturer of infant formula both domestically and globally with its flagship product Enfamil. The company dates back to a firm created by Edward Mead Johnson, one of the co-founders of Johnson & Johnson, who created his own business in 1895, which was renamed Mead Johnson & Company in 1905. The company was majority owned by Bristol-Myers Squibb after an acquisition in 1967, but was spun-off in 2009 as an independent firm.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Postobón Logo
Postobón, S.A. is the largest Colombian beverage company, and also one of the largest in South America. The company has a wide portfolio of products that includes soft drinks, fruit juices, bottled water, tea, and energy drinks. It has created soft drinks such as “Manzana Postobón”, an apple-flavored soda, and its most popular “Colombiana”, a “cola champagne.” Additional flavors of Postobón soda beyond apple include grape, orange, pineapple, and lemon.
You can download thePostobonlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Postobon
item.description: Postobón, S.A. is the largest Colombian beverage company, and also one of the largest in South America. The company has a wide portfolio of products that includes soft drinks, fruit juices, bottled water, tea, and energy drinks. It has created soft drinks such as “Manzana Postobón”, an apple-flavored soda, and its most popular “Colombiana”, a “cola champagne.” Additional flavors of Postobón soda beyond apple include grape, orange, pineapple, and lemon.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Pukka Pies Logo Pukka Pies is a manufacturer of pies based in Syston, Leicestershire, United Kingdom. A family company founded in 1963 by Trevor Storer as “Trevor Storer’s Home Made Pies”, it was named Pukka Pies in 1964. It is currently run by his sons Tim and Andrew. It employs 262 people at its factory in Syston, producing 180,000 pies and pasties per day. Source
You can download thePukka Pieslogo on full-version of the page. ]] >

It employs 262 people at its factory in Syston, producing 180,000 pies and pasties per day. Source

Retail Food Group Logo Retail Food Group Limited, often abbreviated as RFG, is an ASX listed company and Australian franchisor based in Southport, Queensland. It owns numerous companies including Gloria Jean’s Coffees, Brumby’s Bakeries, Donut King, Michel’s Patisserie, Di Bella Coffee, The Coffee Guy, Café2U, Pizza Capers and Crust Pizza. Source
You can download theRFGlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Rivella Logo Rivella is a soft drink from Switzerland, created by Robert Barth in 1952, which is produced from milk whey, and therefore includes ingredients such as lactose, lactic acid and minerals. Other than Switzerland, it is sold in several other countries, notably the Netherlands, and is available in several varieties depending on the country. Source
You can download theRivellalogo on full-version of the page. ]] >

item.description: Rivella is a soft drink from Switzerland, created by Robert Barth in 1952, which is produced from milk whey, and therefore includes ingredients such as lactose, lactic acid and minerals. Other than Switzerland, it is sold in several other countries, notably the Netherlands, and is available in several varieties depending on the country. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Savola Group Logo
The Savola Group is a Saudi Arabian industrial company. The group’s major holdings supply Saudi Arabia, the Middle East and North Africa, and Turkey with edible oils, sugar, fresh dairy products, and restaurants serving fast foods. The group also owns the largest grocery retailing chain in the Middle East, Panda Retail Company. It is ranked as number 9 among top 100 companies in the Saudi Arabian market and ranked as number 2 among the industrial sector after SABIC.
You can download theSavola Grouplogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Savola Group
item.description: The Savola Group is a Saudi Arabian industrial company. The group’s major holdings supply Saudi Arabia, the Middle East and North Africa, and Turkey with edible oils, sugar, fresh dairy products, and restaurants serving fast foods. The group also owns the largest grocery retailing chain in the Middle East, Panda Retail Company. It is ranked as number 9 among top 100 companies in the Saudi Arabian market and ranked as number 2 among the industrial sector after SABIC.

<! [CDATA[
SUJA Juice Logo LSuja Juice is an organic, non-GMO, cold-pressed juice company based in San Diego, California. Suja produces cold-pressed juices, waters and drinking vinegars. It is the largest independent producer of cold-pressed juice sold in the United States. Source
You can download theSUJAlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >

item.description: LSuja Juice is an organic, non-GMO, cold-pressed juice company based in San Diego, California. Suja produces cold-pressed juices, waters and drinking vinegars. It is the largest independent producer of cold-pressed juice sold in the United States. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Upper Crust Logo
In geology, the crust is the outermost solid shell of a rocky planet, dwarf planet, or natural satellite. It is usually distinguished from the underlying mantle by its chemical makeup; however, in the case of icy satellites, it may be distinguished based on its phase. The crusts of Earth, Mercury, Venus, Mars, Io, the Moon and other planetary bodies formed via igneous processes, and were later modified by erosion, impact cratering, volcanism, and sedimentation.
You can download theUpper Crustlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Upper Crust
item.description: In geology, the crust is the outermost solid shell of a rocky planet, dwarf planet, or natural satellite. It is usually distinguished from the underlying mantle by its chemical makeup; however, in the case of icy satellites, it may be distinguished based on its phase. The crusts of Earth, Mercury, Venus, Mars, Io, the Moon and other planetary bodies formed via igneous processes, and were later modified by erosion, impact cratering, volcanism, and sedimentation.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Whitbread Logo
Whitbread PLC is a multinational British hotel and restaurant company headquartered in Houghton Regis, England. The business was founded as a brewery in 1742, and had become the largest brewery in the world by the 1780s. Its largest division is currently Premier Inn, which is the largest hotel brand in the UK with over 785 hotels and 72,000 rooms. Until January 2019 it owned Costa Coffee but sold it to The Coca-Cola Company.
You can download theWhitbreadlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Whitbread
item.description: Whitbread PLC is a multinational British hotel and restaurant company headquartered in Houghton Regis, England. The business was founded as a brewery in 1742, and had become the largest brewery in the world by the 1780s. Its largest division is currently Premier Inn, which is the largest hotel brand in the UK with over 785 hotels and 72,000 rooms. Until January 2019 it owned Costa Coffee but sold it to The Coca-Cola Company.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Red Bull Logo Red Bull is an energy drink sold by Red Bull GmbH, an Austrian company created in 1987. Red Bull has the highest market share of any energy drink in the world, with 7.5 billion cans sold in a year (as of 2019). Austrian entrepreneur Dietrich Mateschitz was inspired by an existing energy drink named Krating Daeng, which was first introduced and sold in Thailand by Chaleo Yoovidhya. He took this idea, modified the ingredients to suit the tastes of Westerners, and, in partnership with Chaleo, founded Red Bull GmbH in 1987 in Chakkapong, Thailand.
You can download theRed Bulllogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Red Bull
item.description: Red Bull is an energy drink sold by Red Bull GmbH, an Austrian company created in 1987. Red Bull has the highest market share of any energy drink in the world, with 7.5 billion cans sold in a year (as of 2019). Austrian entrepreneur Dietrich Mateschitz was inspired by an existing energy drink named Krating Daeng, which was first introduced and sold in Thailand by Chaleo Yoovidhya. He took this idea, modified the ingredients to suit the tastes of Westerners, and, in partnership with Chaleo, founded Red Bull GmbH in 1987 in Chakkapong, Thailand.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 The Coca-Cola Company Logo
The Coca-Cola Company is an American multinational beverage corporation incorporated under Delaware’s General Corporation Law and headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia. The Coca-Cola Company has interests in the manufacturing, retailing, and marketing of nonalcoholic beverage concentrates and syrups. Source
You can download theCoca-Cola Companylogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Coca-Cola Company
item.description: The Coca-Cola Company is an American multinational beverage corporation incorporated under Delaware’s General Corporation Law and headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia. The Coca-Cola Company has interests in the manufacturing, retailing, and marketing of nonalcoholic beverage concentrates and syrups. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 A&W Root Beer Logo
A&W Root Beer is a root beer brand primarily available in the United States and Canada, started in 1919 by Roy W. Allen. In 1922, Allen partnered with Frank Wright. They combined their initials to create the brand “A&W” and inspired a restaurant chain, founded in 1922. Originally, A&W root beer drinks sold for five cents. Source
You can download theAW Root Beerlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: AW Root Beer
item.description: A&W Root Beer is a root beer brand primarily available in the United States and Canada, started in 1919 by Roy W. Allen. In 1922, Allen partnered with Frank Wright. They combined their initials to create the brand “A&W” and inspired a restaurant chain, founded in 1922. Originally, A&W root beer drinks sold for five cents. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Sprite Logo
Sprite is a colorless, caffeine-free, lemon and lime-flavored soft drink created by The Coca-Cola Company. It was first developed in West Germany in 1959 as Fanta Klare Zitrone (“Clear Lemon Fanta”) and was introduced in the United States under the current brand name Sprite in 1961 as a competitor to 7 Up. Source
You can download theSpritelogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Sprite
item.description: Sprite is a colorless, caffeine-free, lemon and lime-flavored soft drink created by The Coca-Cola Company. It was first developed in West Germany in 1959 as Fanta Klare Zitrone (“Clear Lemon Fanta”) and was introduced in the United States under the current brand name Sprite in 1961 as a competitor to 7 Up. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Coca-Cola Logo
Coca-Cola, or Coke, is a carbonated soft drink manufactured by The Coca-Cola Company. Originally marketed as a temperance drink and intended as a patent medicine, it was invented in the late 19th century by John Stith Pemberton and was bought out by businessman Asa Griggs Candler, whose marketing tactics led Coca-Cola to its dominance of the world soft-drink market throughout the 20th century. The drink’s name refers to two of its original ingredients: coca leaves, and kola nuts.
You can download theCoca-Colalogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Coca-Cola
item.description: Coca-Cola, or Coke, is a carbonated soft drink manufactured by The Coca-Cola Company. Originally marketed as a temperance drink and intended as a patent medicine, it was invented in the late 19th century by John Stith Pemberton and was bought out by businessman Asa Griggs Candler, whose marketing tactics led Coca-Cola to its dominance of the world soft-drink market throughout the 20th century. The drink’s name refers to two of its original ingredients: coca leaves, and kola nuts.
